result.execSummary:
All charges against Hans L. Zinsmeister in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hans L. Zinsmeister is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hans L. Zinsmeister

records.addlTxt:
3:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Hans L. Zinsmeister in court. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Hans L. Zinsmeister. Calling 21CM213, 22CM20 & 22CM73. 22CM73 was set for an Initial Appearance yesterday - warrant was issued - Court quashes warrant. Bennett in receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea - would like to set cases out for pretrial. Schiek/Bennet statement to bond. Court sets bond in 21CM73 and continued bond in other cases. adj. 03:34 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on March 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Hans L. Zinsmeister appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Dennis Brown appearing by video. Calling 22CM20 & 21CM213. Defendant has copy of complaint - will be contacting PD's office to get counsel appointed on new case. Court reads on right to counsel. Schiek statement to bond. Court states he is on a probation hold. Court sets bond. Brown states there is an offer in 21CM213 - believes both cases to be resolved. Bond continued in 21CM213. adj. 03:45 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
